hero.title: The Space Challenge: From Classroom to Orbit
hero.description: The Space Challenge is an Ideia Space project that connects the universe to the classroom. We transform students into protagonists, taking them from mission conception to the launch of a real satellite.

problema.title: Why a Space Challenge?
problema.text1: Brazilian education shows low performance in STEM areas (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics). At the same time, the space sector is expanding and faces a shortage of qualified professionals.
problema.text2: We believe that the fascination with space can be the spark for an engaging learning experience. We use the space mission as a tool to empower students for the economy of the future.

desafio.title: What is the Space Challenge?
desafio.description: This is a Space Mission project competition aimed at high school students (14 to 18 years old). The project is designed for one year and impacts different groups of students in progressive stages:

metodologia.title: Our Methodology: Learning by Doing
metodologia.description: Our philosophy is based on Project-Based Learning (PBL) and the "Hands On" concept. The Space Challenge is structured in a 5-step pedagogical path:

conceituar.title: Conceptualize
conceituar.description: Students define the scope and objectives of the mission. They answer: "What problem will my mission solve?".

projetar.title: Design
projetar.description: Teams detail what the space mission will be like and what resources will be needed.

construir.title: Build
construir.description: Students explore the satellite development kit (SMT) and bring the mission to life.

lancar.title: Launch
lancar.description: Selected students build the orbital satellite, perform tests and prepare it for launch.

aplicar.title: Apply
aplicar.description: With the satellite in orbit, students use its data to solve the problem identified in the mission conception.

preDesafio.title: Pre-Challenge
preDesafio.description: Project organization, rule definition, school selection and teacher training.

fase1.title: Phase 1: Conception
fase1.description: Course begins for the 500 students. Focus on problem analysis and space mission conception (MCR).

fase2.title: Phase 2: Design
fase2.description: Students receive SMT Kits. Final project presentation (PDR) and selection of the best teams.

fase3.title: Phase 3: Construction
fase3.description: The 30 selected students build the PocketQube satellite. Testing, delivery and insertion into orbit.

posDesafio.title: Post-Challenge
posDesafio.description: With the satellite in orbit, Ideia Space collects the data and shares it with the institutions.
